name: G.723 ADPCM Audio
summary: Learn about .G723 files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: G.723 is one of several ADPCM audio standards created by the ITU, which is a communications technology-oriented division of the United Nations. It is related to both the G.721 standard and the G.726 standard, which also describe codecs used to transmit spoken audio over a network. G.726 is the newest of these standards; it replaced both the G.721 and G.723 standards.
Primarily, the G.723 audio was used to encode audio transmitted over international or wireless phone networks. So, a G723 audio file likely contains audio spoken during a phone conversation.

instructions: You can use FFmpeg (multiplatform) or libsndfile (multiplatform) to play the audio a G723 file contains.

You can use FFmpeg (multiplatform) or libsndfile (multiplatform) to convert the audio a G723 file contains to other formats. For example, FFmpeg can convert the audio a G723 file contains to many common audio formats, including .MP3, .WAV, .FLAC, and .AAC.
